item.title: Dialogue wont work
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

A simple Google search where the tutorial did in-fact tell you were to add the dialogues. This was my #1 search result on Google…

All credits to Par3210 from rL. You’ll need to find this post and do the pre-requisite tutorial or you’ll most likely encounter errors.

[QUOTE=Par3210;260525][CENTER][SIZE=“6”]NPC Dialogue for Dummies[/SIZE][/CENTER]
OK so welcome to my 4th tutorial, I believe? This one focuses on NPC DIALOGUE. In this tutorial we will be covering the following things:

[ul][]Adding NPC Dialogue
[]Making NPCs SAY this dialogue
[]Adding a CLOSE dialogue so our dialogue won’t keep repeating.
[]Give a choice option
[*]Appropriate voids to place into your client.java which will make this work.[/ul]

Let’s begin then!
[CENTER][SIZE=“6”]1. Adding NPC Dialogue[/SIZE][/CENTER]
Open up your client.java and search for this:

Under it you should find a lot of [COLOR=“blue”]cases[/COLOR].
These are basically the NPC Dialogues. For each time a NPC Dialogue is activated, the previous dialogue will be replaced by the new dialogue.
Using [COLOR=“blue”]cases[/COLOR] makes it far easier to activate and use this NPC Dialogue.
Right, so, under a case, add this.

[COLOR="blue"][B]case 1:[/B][/COLOR]//first case [COLOR="green"][B]talk("You alright there, adventurer?", 943);[/B][/COLOR]//NPC dialogue. The 943 means the NPC ID. [COLOR="red"][B]nextDialogue(2);[/B][/COLOR]//saying which dialogue will be next.. the "2" means case 2: will be used next. break;//ends the dialogue. Without this, you will get errors.
Obviously, the explanation is in the code.
You can change the “You alright there adventurer?” bit to whatever you like.
Please note you [I]MUST[/I] follow Rog3r’s tutorial for the [COLOR=“red”]red code[/COLOR] to work.
Alright. Now we’ve created our dialogue, you can copy and paste it to as many times as you like and simply change the NPC ID (943), case 1: (to the next case, e.g. case 2),
nextDialogue(2); to nextDialogue(3);, etc…
[CENTER][SIZE=“6”]2. Adding a CLOSE dialogue[/SIZE][/CENTER]
When you have created all the dialogue you need, you will need to make a [COLOR=“red”]CLOSE DIALOGUE[/COLOR]. This does what it says on the tin.
It closes the final dialogue you have created. If you don’t have it, the dialogue will not close when you click the [COLOR=“blue”]Click here to continue[/COLOR] button.

[COLOR="blue"][B]case 2:[/B][/COLOR]//close dialogue case [COLOR="green"][B]closeAll();[/B][/COLOR]//obvious.. closes the dialogue break;//without this you'd get errors.

Congratulations! That’s your NPC dialogue part complete! Now we have to make the respective NPC say it.
Don’t worry, it gets easier from here on now you know the basics

[CENTER][SIZE=“6”]3. Making NPCs SAY the dialogue we created[/SIZE][/CENTER]
OK, let’s get this done!
Open up your client.java again and search for this:

This will bring you to a whole lot of code. Scroll down a little and you may find something a little like this:

if (NPCID == 945){ NpcDialogue = 1; NpcDialogueSend = false; PutNPCCoords = true; }
This is a example of a NPC that is going to say case 1: dialogue.
Make a copy of this and paste it above or below another npc dialogue code around this.
All you need to do here is replace the “945” with your NPC ID, and also the “1” with whatever your case number is.
Easy stuff.

[CENTER][SIZE=“6”]4. Give a choice option[/SIZE][/CENTER]
Ah… now this is where it gets a little bit trickier. Find your NPC dialogue again by searching for

Below your other NPC dialogues… add this.

case 2:
choice("I'm fine!", "Never mind.");
break;[/CODE]
This is obviously going to come up with a choice option. Between "I'm fine!" and "Never mind.".
Easy stuff, sure. But how do we make these choices work??
Well my friend. I will tell you :). Open up clickingMost.java, or ActionButtons.java, whichever one your server uses.
Inside it, search for this.
[CODE]case 9157:[/CODE]
This "case" handles what happens when you click the first choice in the list.
So basically this is what we will use to determine what happens when we click "I'm fine!" choice.
You'll obviously need to change things so the dialogue follows on to say something like "Oh, that's good.." or something creative like that.
I'll give you some example code.
[CODE]if(c.NpcDialogue == 2) {
c.NpcDialogue = 3;
c.NpcDialogueSend = false;
}

I hope this is obvious now. If the choice option is displayed, “case 3” will start.
You’ll need to make a case 3: yourself. Simply copy and paste “case 1:” which we made earlier.
That’s the “I’m fine!” option made. Now our “Never mind.” option needs to be dealt with.
Search for:

This handles the second choice, e.g. our “Never mind.” option.

			if(c.NpcDialogue == 2) {
				c.closeAll();
				}

This means, if the choice option is displayed and the player clicks “Never mind.” it will close the dialogue.
[CENTER][SIZE=“6”]5. The voids you need to make this work.[/SIZE][/CENTER]
You will need to copy and paste the following “voids” under:

Which is at the very top of your client.java…

	public void talk(String text, int npc) {
		sendFrame200(4883, 591);//sendFrame200(4901, 591);
		sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npc), 4884);
		sendFrame126(text, 4885);
		sendFrame126("Click here to continue.", 4886);
		sendFrame75(npc, 4883);//sendFrame75(npc, 4901);
		sendFrame164(4882);
		NpcDialogueSend = true;
	}
	public void talk2(String text, String text2, int npc) {
		sendFrame200(4901, 591);
		sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npc), 4902);
		sendFrame126("", 4903);
		sendFrame126(text, 4904);
		sendFrame126(text2, 4905);
		sendFrame126("", 4906);
		sendFrame75(npc, 4901);
		sendFrame164(4900);
	}
	public void talk3(String text, String text2, String text3, int npc) {
		sendFrame200(4901, 591);
		sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npc), 4902);
		sendFrame126(text, 4903);
		sendFrame126(text2, 4904);
		sendFrame126(text3, 4905);
		sendFrame126("", 4906);
		sendFrame75(npc, 4901);
		sendFrame164(4900);
	}
	public void talk4(String text, String text2, String text3, String text4, int npc) {
		sendFrame200(4901, 591);
		sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npc), 4902);
		sendFrame126(text, 4903);
		sendFrame126(text2, 4904);
		sendFrame126(text3, 4905);
		sendFrame126(text4, 4906);
		sendFrame75(npc, 4901);
		sendFrame164(4900);
	}

	public void choice(String text, String text2) {
		changeText126("Select an Option", 2460);
		changeText126(text, 2461);
		changeText126(text2, 2462);
		sendFrame164(2459);
	}
	
	public void options2(String option, String option2){ //2 options (case 56109, case 56110) - Action buttons
            changeText126("Select an Option", 14444);
            changeText126(option, 14445);
            changeText126(option2, 14446);
            sendFrame164(14443);
	}
	public void options3(String option, String option2, String option3){ //3
            changeText126("Select an Option", 2470);
            changeText126(option, 2471);
            changeText126(option2, 2472);
	    changeText126(option3, 2473);
            sendFrame164(2469);
	}
	public void options4(String option, String option2, String option3, String option4){//4
            changeText126("Select an Option", 8208);
            changeText126(option, 8209);
            changeText126(option2, 8210);
	    changeText126(option3, 8211);
	    changeText126(option4, 8212);
            sendFrame164(8207);
	}
	public void options5(String option, String option2, String option3, String option4, String option5){//5
            changeText126("Select an Option", 8220);
            changeText126(option, 8221);
            changeText126(option2, 8222);
	    changeText126(option3, 8223);
	    changeText126(option4, 8224);
	    changeText126(option5, 8225);
            sendFrame164(8219);
	}

That basically wraps everything up! I hope I explained things well… :S

Credits:
95% Me, Par3210
5% Creator of the voids “talk”, “options” and “choice”.[/QUOTE]

Read full topic

Add the NPC’s dialogue.

What tutorials did you try? Why didn’t they work and what errors, if any, were there?
